job_description:
2022 Virtual Summer Associate Program – Operations, ACPNY
EmblemHealth is a family of health and wellness companies that believes in our mission to create healthier futures for our customers, patients, and communities. Everything we do is guided by our core values:

Empower
We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.
Deliver
We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.
Do It Together
We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.
As one of the nation’s largest not-for-profit health insurers, EmblemHealth serves more than three million people in the New York tristate area. We are anchored by our 80-year-old not-for-profit roots while remaining change agents fueled by innovation and excellence to create better health outcomes.

Our family of companies also includes ConnectiCare, one of Connecticut’s leading health plans; AdvantageCare Physicians, a primary and specialty medical group; and WellSpark, a digital wellness company.

We are proud that our workforce is as diverse as the communities we serve, and we are intentional about our inclusive practices for our organization.
If you want to be a part of a bigger story, if you want to make a difference in people lives and the communities around you, if you think healthcare matters to every one of us – Join us!
Operations
The Operations team is responsible for managing and leading the health care delivery processes in the medical offices across five regions including Manhattan, Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens, and Long Island. Operations leaders drive change, solve complex problems, and create dynamic new approaches that will improve the value, quality, and cost of patient care. In collaboration with cross functional groups, (strategy, clinical, nursing, human resources, and IT) the operations group plans, implements and evaluates processes and workflows designed to optimize care delivery and create patient service excellence.

Summer Associate Program
The Summer Associate Program provides opportunity for students to work alongside of senior leaders who are committed to growing, developing, and empowering the next generation of healthcare leaders. The Operations Summer Associate will work on special projects designed by the business and participate in the following career development activities:
Introduction to the Health Care IndustrySenior Leadership Networking LunchLearning & Development SeriesFinal Project Presentations
Program Details
9-week paid program; Monday, June 6, 2022 to Friday, August 5, 2022Full-time; 40-hours per weekHourly rate of $30 per hourProject-driven
We are looking for candidates who are -
Pursing an undergraduate or graduate degree in the healthcare Industry; rising undergraduate juniors/seniors, and first-year graduate students strongly preferredStrong academic performance, minimum GPA of 3.0 or above preferredAnalytical, collaborative, and strong communication skillsProject management

summary: Oversee daily operations through collaboration with CEO and senior management, performing an array of administrative tasks from handling schedules, attending…
location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY
job_description:
Tinder started on a college campus in 2012 and broke down the barriers - geographic, historic, cultural - that limit who we meet. We went from 1 swipe to 1 billion swipes a day, in 2 years! No technology grows that fast unless it fills a powerful, unmet human need. Today, Tinder is the world’s most popular app for meeting new people. The app is available in 190 countries, and 40+ languages, it’s been downloaded more than 450 million times and led to 60 billion matches, and is the highest-grossing non-gaming app globally. There’s never been a more exciting time to be at Tinder. We are on a course to redefine the way young people meet and connect today, if you would like to be a part of that, keep reading.
The Role:
We’re looking for an Executive Assistant to join our team! Reporting to our CEO, you will provide outstanding daily administrative support and get energized by working in a fast-paced environment. This is a perfect role for someone who takes initiative, is intuitive, and thinks strategically. Although this position may offer some remote work flexibility, this role will be based in our New York office and will require travel to our San Francisco and Los Angeles offices as needed.
In addition to managing the CEO’s complex calendar and schedule, you will work with cross-functional global leaders and provide high caliber administrative support that will help us execute company projects and goals. Your creativity, passion, and organizational skills will be critical in supporting the CEO team meetings and special events. We are looking for someone to help build and lead organizational culture in hybrid and remote working environments across the US and globally.
Administrative Support
Oversee daily operations through collaboration with CEO and senior management, performing an array of administrative tasks from handling schedules, attending meetings and calls, maintaining team communications, and ensure execution of action items and follow-ups
Build presentations, create meeting agendas, maintain meeting notes, and optimize meetings for different time zones to support our distributed international team
Serve as liaison between staff, executives, and senior leaders, regarding company climate, employee well-being, project updates, proposals, and planning
Arrange domestic and international travel and provide ongoing support as needed
Assist the HR department with new hires, collect documentation, help facilitate onboarding, and collaborate to address and resolve all employee concerns
Prioritize, multi-task, and operate in a continuously evolving environment
Handle projects and communication by providing status updates and ensuring that cross-functional partners are included in meetings and communications
Build and run an organized department library of resources and documentation and identify any gaps with team members
Collaborate with workplace experience for team space planning & strategy
Team Morale, Events and Celebrations
Partner with cross functional teams to plan and execute meetings and offsites
Identify the team’s learning and training opportunities, and partner with our Talent Development team to work on resources or communicate training needs
Work closely with the workplace experience and HR teams to coordinate birthdays and landmark celebrations
Manage team swag
Complete other duties as assigned
What we’re looking for:
3+ years of work experience supporting at the senior executive level
Experience supporting hybrid and global teams
Flexibility beyond standard office hours
Experience with Google-Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Slides, etc.)
Ability to adapt to changing priorities with excellent time management skills
Positive relationship management skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with a diverse set of partners
Demonstrate discretion and integrity when working on confidential business and organizational issues
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated presentation skills, with an ability to express high-level concepts efficiently and effectively to a wide range of audiences
Strong project management skills
Based on Tinder’s vaccination policy and considering this position is a crucial in-office support function, the successful candidate is required to be fully-vaccinated against Covid-19 with one of the United States FDA-approved vaccine options. If an exemption and/or accommodation to our vaccination policy is requested, a member of the human resources department will be available to begin the interactive accommodation process.

At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience.

summary: Under immediate guidance, an *Web Order Processor* will help to process and finalize orders that were placed independently by customers online.

We are opening more locations every year and we are always looking for qualified individuals to join us in our growth. We are a company that promotes from within, both in our retail and corporate operations.Under immediate guidance, an Web Order Processor will help to process and finalize orders that were placed independently by customers online. Our contact center, located in North Phoenix, facilitates interactions with customers through both inbound calls, e-mails, and web orders. WE PAY YOU WHILE WE TRAIN YOU!Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Reviews orders for product requirements such as sizing, fitment, and safety standards. summary:

job_description:
$1,500 SIGN-ON BONUSES OFFERED!
PAY RATE: $20-$25.50/hour based on experience with the opportunity to be promoted from within
SHIFT: Full-time first shift (8am-4:30pm) Monday through Friday
About Safecor Health
Safecor Health is an industry leader and essential employer committed to helping hospitals ensure quality and patient safety. We do this by providing unit-dose medication packaging services for hospital and health system pharmacies, pharmaceutical manufacturers, and digital pharmacy companies. By taking away the challenging and time-consuming tasks of repackaging, Safecor Health allows hospital pharmacy staff to refocus their attention back to what really matters: our loved ones.
The role of the Packaging Technician
Our packaging technicians apply a disciplined packaging and barcoding service to specific medications in our production facilities. This important work we do helps our hospital customers deliver safe, high-quality medication and care to their patients.
You will be responsible for repackaging all unit-dose medications as required. This includes operating our packaging equipment to repackage oral solids into unit-dose, and filling cups, vials, and syringes as specified. The packaging technician position is also responsible for maintaining the packaging equipment for daily use, including cleaning and general equipment troubleshooting.
What you bring to the table:
If you're looking for stability and longevity with the opportunity to grow your career, you could be a great fit for our diverse team of packaging technicians.
Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality
Working knowledge of computer hardware (PC Windows)
Working knowledge of mechanical packaging equipment, a plus
Good organizational skills - accurate, reliable, and efficient
High school diploma or equivalent required
Previous experience in hospital pharmacy or health care industry preferred
Pharmacy Technician Certification a plus
What your day-to-day will look like:
Safecor Health is a fast-paced, high-energy workplace with ample opportunities to learn new skills each day.
Perform all unit-dose medication packaging and complete daily orders as needed.
Maintain supplies needed in the workstation to fulfill services.
Perform daily preventative maintenance and necessary routine adjustments on the packaging equipment.
Generate accurate packaging labels according to requirements regarding verification procedures as specified in our standard operating procedures.
Follow standard operating procedures in accordance with current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and other regulatory standards.
How we take care of you and your family:
The meaningful work you do helps our customers support their patients, so we'll work hard to support you.
$1,500 sign-on bonus!
Clean and safe work environment
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Company-paid life insurance
Paid time off (PTO)
Earned sick time (EST)
Holiday pay
Weekly pay
401k
Opportunities for internal promotion
Monthly employee appreciation meals

job_description:
Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:

In-office locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Remote location(s): United States.
Minimum qualifications:

2 years of experience in business administration, quantitative analysis, and operations
Experience in SQL and other reporting tools and techniques
Experience in statistics and executive-level dashboarding of data, and in process improvement
Experience with building solutions for enterprise-level processes (e.g., finance, planning and budgeting, business intelligence, operations, etc.)
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in management consulting, corporate development, finance/investment banking, or operations
Experience leading complex operational and strategic initiatives across various organizations
Experience with executive-level communication and influencing successfully across levels and organizational boundaries
Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment
Exceptional at converting unshaped issues into crisp, concrete challenges to be solved
About the job
Google Cloud enables digital transformations for organizations of all sizes, operating in all industries and geographies. The Chief of Staff organization within Business Platform and Cloud Operations (BP&CO) supports Google Cloud growth, working with Google Cloud business leaders to identify strategic priorities and design and implement business processes to support them.
In this role, you will lead the strategy and execution of operational projects such as designing and implementing a headcount management process, executing the organization’s talent strategy, executive and project reporting, and strategic planning. You'll focus on data collection, draw insights from analysis, and then develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. You will be comfortable with structuring complicated issues and finding creative solutions to business challenges. You'll work in a rapidly changing environment and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.
You will be highly strategic, comfortable with ambiguity, and an exceptional communicator with a bias for action and results. You'll be an agile and creative problem solver, and an outstanding cross-functional and executive-level relationship builder.
Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Additional Information

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $124,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
Responsibilities
Create and execute on operational processes and practices that drive efficiencies for the organization.
Gather and analyze large amounts of information and turn it into compelling, insightful recommendations.
Build consensus among cross-functional teams and influence decision making with executive-level audiences. Lead execution against recommendations quickly and accurately.
Identify opportunities to develop strategic recommendations, execution plans, and key performance indicators to improve the operations of the BP&CO organization.
Foster a culture of high organizational performance through internal and cross-group initiatives.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

job_description: At ConsenSys we have a vision of a world where data sovereignty and financial well-being is accessible to every person and organization. We believe Ethereum and decentralized protocol technology is a more trustworthy and equitable foundation for how we create and share value across the web. On this trusted, open source foundation, we can accelerate the world’s transition to a universally accessible network of distributed participants where transparency, security and freedom are fundamental.Our product suite, composed of Truffle, Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets. As the leading Ethereum software company, ConsenSys enables developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web. To learn more about ConsenSys, and explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.Why join ConsenSys?Remote first. You’ll be joining a team based all over the world. Providing the unique opportunity to work with people from across 6 continents. We encourage our people to travel and connect in person either through retreats, conferences, or just for fun!Flexible working arrangements. You can create the work week that works for you with flexible hours and locations. We believe everyone has the right to individual sovereignty. We empower and support you to make your own schedule and own your own time.Continuous learning and opportunities. As a destination employer, ConsenSys is committed to your growth and development. We provide continuous on the job learning and opportunities, as well as offering the comprehensive ConsenSys Advance Program which includes full access to Coursera training courses, bespoke training programmes, technical learning sessions and our world class blockchain and Ethereum Academy.Unlimited vacation/holidays. We value downtime to recharge and reset, ensuring everyone at ConsenSys has work/life balance. Company-wide we participate in “zero productivity” days to take a break from work, shut down, and sit back and relax.One of the most recognized tech companies in the blockchain ecosystem globally. Work experience at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your future career. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem.About People & TalentPeople and Talent support the entire ConsenSys community. We strive to be the destination employer of choice for our ecosystem. That goal is embedded in all the work we do to attract, retain and support our amazing talent. By joining our team you’ll be working with a diverse group of incredible individuals who put ‘people first’ and are designing and building the workplace of the future.What you’ll doAs the operations coordinator you will be our day to day superhero for all things ops. You will be managing many of our internal systems to ensure our business runs smoothly and all deadlines are met. You’ll be working closely with the entire People & Talent function feeding key information to the Ops team.Your role will be split over multiple different projects ensuring consistency across all systems and data integrity while also being our 3rd party voice for day-to-day tasks, systems and additional projects. One of the projects you’ll be working on will be onboarding new hires through assisting with data implementation, supporting any needs of new hires, liaising with People Partners & Leads, organizing any onboarding orientations, learning sessions, and new hire check-ins across the organization, and co-managing equipment procurement.You will also be responsible for the day to day maintenance of our HR software tool Namely reviewing data, flagging any updates, building out current systems, running reports, managing training and sending weekly reports. For our additional HR platforms, TriNet and Velocity PEO, you will be serving as the admin for these tools ensuring all new hires are added to relevant platforms, verifying documentation, submitting payroll, connecting with platform reps, managing the operational piece of terminations, and communicating to the wider team on any compliance issues globally.As well as your operational skills we’re looking for an individual who has a passion for helping others and building out systems that do that. You’ll be the doer for any operational requests that come through ZenDesk and ensure we have an active voice in our ecosystem. There will also be many opportunities to bring your unique skill set to a project you are passionate about in supporting our key goals as an operational team for the larger ConsenSys community.Would be great if you brought this to the roleThe ability to work across multiple different systems and platforms with easeA clear understanding and comfortability with tools and technology systems for HRConfident in managing the full lifecycle of new hires onboarding experienceA data expert who can manage insights from numerous tools while ensuring data integrity across all systemsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong organizational, time management skills and the ability to self-organizeGeneral knowledge of customer service tools and workflowsCan-do attitude and a willingness to step into new processes, or areas of work, outside your field of expertiseDon't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Job Type: Full-timePay: $30,206.00 - $73,056.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible schedulePaid time offProfessional development assistanceSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: Remote

Job Summary:
Join our team of over 5,000 employees globally, who provide the insights through data and next generation technology that help millions of people find, buy and protect the homes they love. From the beginning, CoreLogic has been driven by a single purpose – to innovate and create solutions that solve our clients’ toughest challenges in the housing market. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with deep knowledge of powerful economic, social, and environmental forces that promote healthy housing markets and thriving communities.
We apply that same dedication to creating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking. A place where individuals can work on small teams, feel valued, and directly impact the real estate industry. We believe our team members are the best in the business, and we will continue to recruit, retain, develop and reward our most important asset – our people!
Job Description:
Job Duties
Conducts research of data. Leverages all available resources such as existing databases, third party sources and/or public information on the internet.
Contacts clients/outside customers to clarify information. Utilizes tools to analyze, query and manipulate data according to defined business procedures. Extracts and enters appropriate data onto application, other form, or database.
Process payments which may require preparing, balancing, and submitting complex wire disbursements for mass manual payments.
May proofread documents for grammatical, mathematical, typographical and composition errors adhering to standards and guidelines. Offers suggestions to improve readability.
Adhere to all required company and client driven Service Level Agreements
Performs duties such as maintaining all level of files, searching and investigating information contained in files, processing departmental documents requiring more specific knowledge of functional operations and entering report results into tracking system.
May track progress and provide status report to management on achievement of daily and weekly team goals.
May act as Subject Matter Expert on internal and client projects making recommendations to these processes.
Able to develop and maintain business relationships with individuals representing other departments, and/or representing outside organizations.
Job Qualifications:
Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills
College degree preferred, High School Diploma or equivalent required
2+ years related experience in lieu of college degree
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required for reporting, presentations, information sharing
Excellent customer and listening skills - builds customer confidence through commitment and delivery of customer satisfaction
Intermediate to advanced computer skills to retrieve, query, create, update and manipulate documents and spreadsheets containing formulas and formatting
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
Tenacity for solving detailed / complex issues
Strong analytical skills
Ability to train and provide feedback to others
Ability to collaborate with peers, other departments and clients to improve processes and share best practices
CoreLogic's Diversity Commitment:
CoreLogic is fully committed to employing a diverse workforce and creating an inclusive work environment that embraces everyone’s unique contributions, experiences and values. We offer an empowered work environment that encourages creativity, initiative and professional growth and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. We are better together when we support and recognize our differences.
EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability:
CoreLogic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to attracting and retaining the best-qualified people available, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or status as a veteran of the Armed Forces, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. CoreLogic maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.
Please apply on our website for consideration.
Privacy Policy - http://www.corelogic.com/privacy.aspx

Message & data rates may apply. You can opt out at any time by responding STOP or UNSUBSCRIBING and will automatically be opted out company-wide.

This announcement is non-bargaining.


Work Schedule: Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 4:30pm
Compressed/Flexible Schedule: Available
Telework: Available
Duty Location Status: Will work remotely from home.
Position Description Title/PD#: Supervisory IT Specialist (PLCYPLN)/ PD193940
Relocation/Recruitment Incentives: Not Authorized
Financial Disclosure Report: Not Required
Physical Demands: The work is sedentary and does not require any special physical effort. Duties may require
lifting and carrying computer equipment such as monitors and printers. Supervisory Probationary Period: Applicants selected for this position may be required to serve a one-year supervisory probationary period. Failure to successfully complete the supervisory probationary period will result in the employee being reassigned to a position in the agency of no lower grade and pay than the one the employee left to accept the supervisory or managerial position.

Major Duties:
Defines and implements the Technology Business Management (TBM) strategy in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, including facilitation of working sessions of medium to large sized groups across all levels of the organization.
Formulates plans and proper courses of action to implement TBM program objectives on a timely and accurate basis and ensures proper coordination with the necessary officials.
Participates in government-wide TBM implementation groups and provides expert TBM technical advice to other IT Specialists and/or personnel.
Serves as an agency expert on TBM and represents the organization in meetings with representatives of industry, other agencies, public organizations, etc., to resolve problems, develop joint policies/standards and exchanges information regarding Technology Business.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this job.
Selectees are subject to a background/suitability investigation.
Designated and/or random drug testing may be required
Selectees may be required to serve a probationary period.
Selective Service Registration is required for males born after 12/31/1959.
A complete application package, i.e., Resume, Transcripts, etc., as required by the job announcement.
Selected applicants will be required to complete an online onboarding process.
Participation in the Seasonal Influenza Prevention Program for VHA Health Care Personnel (HCP) is a requirement for all Department of Veterans Affairs HCP.
All applicants tentatively selected for VA employment in a testing designated position are subject to urinalysis to screen for illegal drug use prior to appointment. Applicants who refuse to be tested will be denied employment with VA.
Must be proficient in written and spoken English.
Qualifications
To qualify for this position, applicants must meet all requirements by the closing date of this announcement, 02/14/2022.

You may qualify based on your experience as described below.

Experience - Experience must be IT related; the experience may be demonstrated by paid or unpaid experience and/or completion of specific, intensive training (for example, IT certification), as appropriate.

For all positions individuals must have IT-related experience demonstrating each of the four competencies listed below. The employing agency is responsible for identifying the specific level of proficiency required for each competency at each grade level based on the requirements of the position being filled.
Attention to Detail - Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.
Customer Service - Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services.
Oral Communication - Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately.
Problem Solving - Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations.
AND

Specialized Experience: You must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade (GS-13) in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Specialized experience is defined as overseeing and managing work necessary to design, implement, maintain, and/or modify Technology Business Management (TBM) data and reports to facilitate usage of the data to make decisions; providing support for IT investments and initiatives; participating in the coordination of enterprise architecture, IT capital planning and portfolio management, IT strategy and performance management, and IT governance.

Such experience is typically gained in the IT field or through the performance of work where the primary concern is IT.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religions; spiritual; community; student; social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Note: A full year of work is considered to be 35-40 hours of work per week. Part-time experience will be credited on the basis of time actually spent in appropriate activities. Applicants wishing to receive credit for such experience must indicate clearly the nature of their duties and responsibilities in each position and the number of hours a week spent in such employment. For more information on these qualification standards, please visit OPM's web site at http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/standards/indexes/alph-ndx.asp.
Education
There is no education substitution at the GS- 14 grade level.

NOTE: Participation in the seasonal influenza program is a condition of employment and a requirement for all Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Personnel (HCP). It is a requirement that all HCP to receive annual seasonal influenza vaccination or obtain an exemption for medical or religious reasons. Wearing a face mask is required when an exemption to the influenza vaccination has been granted. HCP in violation of this directive may face disciplinary action up to and including removal from federal service. HCP are individuals who, during the influenza season, work in VHA locations or who come into contact with VA patients or other HCP as part of their duties. VHA locations include, but are not limited to, VA hospitals and associated clinics, community living centers (CLCs), community-based outpatient clinics (CBOCs), domiciliary units, Vet centers and VA-leased medical facilities. HCP include all VA licensed and unlicensed, clinical and administrative, remote and onsite, paid and without compensation, full- and part-time employees, intermittent employees, fee basis employees, VA contractors, researchers, volunteers and health professions trainees (HPTs) who are expected to perform any or all of their work at these facilities. HPTs may be paid or unpaid and include residents, interns, fellows and students. HCP also includes VHA personnel providing home-based care to Veterans and drivers and other personnel whose duties put them in contact with patients outside VA medical facilities.

Additional Information: Per Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not usually be part of the employee's position is creditable; however, the experience is considered creditable when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignments. The documentation must indicate whether the employee performed the duties full time or, if part-time, the percentage of times the employee performed the additional duties. The employee should be able to locate this documentation in their official personnel record. To receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate and official documentation of such experience as indicated above.
Additional information
COVID-19 Pandemic Expanded Telework Program - Due to COVID-19, VA is currently in an expanded telework posture. If selected, you may be expected to temporarily telework, even if your home is located outside the local commuting area. Once employees are permitted to return to the office, you will be expected to report to the duty station listed on this announcement. Management officials will provide information about returning to the official, pre-pandemic worksite, when applicable. At that time, you may be eligible to request to continue to telework depending upon the terms of your organization's telework policy and the duties of the position.VA supports the use of telework as a way to help attract and retain talented individuals in public service, increase worker productivity, and better prepare the agency to operate during emergencies. This position may be authorized for telework. Telework eligibility will be discussed during the interview process.

The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) and Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) provide eligible displaced VA competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. To be well-qualified, applicants must possess experience that exceeds the minimum qualifications of the position including all selective factors if applicable, and must be proficient in most of the requirements of the job. Information about ICTAP and CTAP eligibility is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website which can be found at https://www.opm.gov/.

Receiving Service Credit for Earning Annual (Vacation) Leave: Federal Employees earn annual leave at a rate (4, 6 or 8 hours per pay period) which is based on the number of years they have served as a Federal employee. VA may offer newly-appointed Federal employee's credit for their job-related non-federal experience or active duty uniformed military service. This credited service can be used in determining the rate at which they earn annual leave. Such credit must be requested and approved prior to the appointment date and is not guaranteed.

job_description:
Do you want to work for a world-leading manufacturer who strives to build a better future through sustainability and innovation? Are you looking for a new challenge in a stable, fast-growing sector?
Join us, and build your career by helping us build the future.
We are a global leader in sustainable products with more than 21,000 team members worldwide. From infinitely recyclable aluminum cans, cups, and aerosol bottles, to aerospace solutions that enable our customers to have a deeper understanding of our planet and the universe. We produce all these incredible things with one unique purpose: crafting a better community, a better society, a better world.
Moreover, each of us has a deep commitment to diversity and inclusion which is the foundation of our culture of belonging. And everyone at Ball is an everyday champion, making a difference by doing what we love.
We lead with our heads and our hearts and combine innovative thinking with a spirit of resiliency that keeps us moving forward in a relentless pursuit of new ways to make life, and the world, better. Whether we’re developing packaging that’s infinitely recyclable or aerospace innovations. Because what we create may change, but what we will always make is a difference.
Primary purpose of the position:
Performs and ensures that efficient production is maintained throughout the plant. Troubleshoots problems and corrects deficiencies to ensure successful production.
Essential Responsible Areas:
You will perform repairs and maintenance on equipment, to include preventative maintenance for building and grounds
Troubleshoot, repair, install, erect, move and/or dismantle all types of machinery and auxiliary
production equipment.
You will Inspect job site and equipment to be dismantled, erected or moved; analyzes blueprints and
schematics; estimates weight of loads to be handled, lifted, clearances and recommends support
equipment needed
Accepts and rejects parts for the department; recommends qualities, dimensions, and the priorities
and disposition of parts; repairs and installs equipment as necessary.
Receives instructions, prints and work orders. Makes drawings or sketches of parts to be made or
repaired.
Perform layout work
You will fabricate sheet metal and structural units as needed: guarding, steps, stairs, conveyors, elevators,
and platforms, sets in place.
Willingness to learn how to drive a forklift or aero lift.
Follow job safety practices, policies, and procedures for safe performance of assignments
Must wear appropriate safety glasses, hearing protection, clothing, and footwear in
appropriate areas and follow safety practices
Work a 12 hour rotating shift, it is expected to be 3 on / 3 off. Shifts will rotate from days to nights every 2 weeks.
Position Requirement & competencies:
High school Diploma or equivalent required
Minimum of 1 year job related experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Working knowledge of the following areas: hand and power tools, precision measuring instruments, perform basic mathematical calculations, aptitude for mechanics, operate and use a computer
Decision Quality. Makes good decisions (without considering how much time it takes) based upon a
mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment; most of his/her solutions and suggestions
turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time; sought out by others for advice and
solutions
Follow EHS procedures including maintaining compliance to certification requirements and use appropriate PPE for each assigned task; make recommendations to improve ergonomics, health and safety of work.
Compensation & Benefits
Hiring Pay Rate: $28.76 (Salary to be determined by the applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.)
Other Compensation: This role will be eligible to participate in the annual incentive compensation plan.
Regular Full-Time Salaried and Hourly positions: Ball includes a comprehensive benefits structure, Go to our career site and click "Total Rewards" to learn more.

These often appear legitimate, but Ball does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview (In person or via WebEx). All email correspondence from Ball Corporation ends in “@ball.com.” Please also be advised that Ball will never request payment or require candidates to deposit a check during the recruitment and onboarding processes. If you have questions about any open positions at Ball, please visit our careers website at https://jobs.ball.com/.

summary: Responsible for providing work order management support, program administration and reporting; and other activities as assigned.
job_description:
About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
Responsible for providing work order management support, program administration and reporting; and other activities as assigned
Receives and coordinates maintenance repair calls: scheduling, follow-up, quote preparation, problem resolution, and post-service activities. Completes repair service work orders/projects
Works with Operations Managers, Account Managers and Category Managers for resolution of problems
Manages complex client projects from beginning to successful completion
Follows up with client home office contact to make sure service delivery, work orders, and special projects are completed in a timely and satisfactory manner
Completes special projects as needed
Communicate with clients daily to maintain a first-class relationship using phone, email, reports, internal, client, and 3rd-party systems
Review and prioritize open work for follow-up and attention based on age, status, or other factors; perform appropriate follow-up
Work with internal groups (Sourcing Team, Operations Team, Category Management, Billing) to communicate customer requirements and to resolve any challenges, issues, or new opportunities
Work with client and service provider personnel to set up systems, maintain access and usability, provide training, and coordinate any IT or other projects
Provide required reporting, data, and dispatch updates for assigned units of business

Conduct periodic weekly calls to run through any updates, check-ups, and basic information sharing
Analyse weekly trades with high volume of calls and provide solutions to decrease volume
Perform other duties, activities, or projects as assigned
Requires participating in afterhours call rotation for dispatching and following up on afterhours emergencies

What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

2022 Virtual Summer Associate Program – Operations, ACPNY
EmblemHealth is a family of health and wellness companies that believes in our mission to create healthier futures for our customers, patients, and communities. Everything we do is guided by our core values:

Empower
We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.
Deliver
We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.
Do It Together
We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.
As one of the nation’s largest not-for-profit health insurers, EmblemHealth serves more than three million people in the New York tristate area. We are anchored by our 80-year-old not-for-profit roots while remaining change agents fueled by innovation and excellence to create better health outcomes.

Our family of companies also includes ConnectiCare, one of Connecticut’s leading health plans; AdvantageCare Physicians, a primary and specialty medical group; and WellSpark, a digital wellness company.

We are proud that our workforce is as diverse as the communities we serve, and we are intentional about our inclusive practices for our organization.
If you want to be a part of a bigger story, if you want to make a difference in people lives and the communities around you, if you think healthcare matters to every one of us – Join us!
Operations
The Operations team is responsible for managing and leading the health care delivery processes in the medical offices across five regions including Manhattan, Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens, and Long Island. Operations leaders drive change, solve complex problems, and create dynamic new approaches that will improve the value, quality, and cost of patient care. In collaboration with cross functional groups, (strategy, clinical, nursing, human resources, and IT) the operations group plans, implements and evaluates processes and workflows designed to optimize care delivery and create patient service excellence.

The Summer Associate Program provides opportunity for students to work alongside of senior leaders who are committed to growing, developing, and empowering the next generation of healthcare leaders. Introduction to the Health Care IndustrySenior Leadership Networking LunchLearning & Development SeriesFinal Project Presentations

job_description:
Research Operation Specialist
Product Experience | San Francisco, CA or Seattle, WA or Remote - US

This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming.

Our agreement with employees
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team

Our Product Experience team - Design, Information, and Insights - focuses on our customers and their business needs. We contribute from the concept all the way to the building of world-class product experiences by partnering with Product Managers, Program Managers, Software Engineers and other cross-functional teams. Together, we are a team of craftspeople who aim to make the complex look easy. We employ insights, pixels, and words to solve big problems and make delightful experiences.

This position
Research Operation Specialists at DocuSign are responsible for orchestrating meaningful solutions that advance the impact of UX Research teams at scale. Your work in this role will have a direct and meaningful impact on improving the overall experiences of our products. This individual will help create streamlined processes and programs that ensure research value across our entire Produce Experience organization.

Success in this role will require effective collaboration across several stakeholder groups to create alignment, efficient working agreements, and clear expectations. It will also depend on building strong relationships with researchers, establishing solid rapports and instilling trust throughout. Last, success in this role will be defined by exceptional organizational skills and a strong desire to not only create, but maintain mutually beneficial outcomes.

Our Product Experience organization is growing fast. With that, this individual will need to have a growth mindset and an ability to address the operational needs of the organization in a tactically efficient manner.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to Manager of Research Operations and is designated Flex.

Responsibilities

Own and manage full-cycle recruiting efforts for multiple research teams and their initiatives
Identify processes, programs, or products that allow our team to capitalize on creative solutions which minimize effort and maximize value
Work actively and effectively with stakeholders to advance research initiatives in a relevant and timely manner
Manage several moving parts to any particular project, remaining mindful of scope, constraints, dependencies, and roadblocks
Track, measure, and report work that is carried out by the team to identify strengths as well as areas for improvement
Become knowledgeable of UX Research practices to effectively create and maintain cohesion between ResOps and UX Research
Identify possible solutions that streamline existing processes, being mindful of integration and automation opportunities
Cultivate an expectation across our Product Experience organization that enables and empowers our researchers to conduct world-class UX Research

Basic qualifications

BA/BS or MS/MA degree or equivalent work experience
2+ years experience working in a SaaS, PaaS, and/or IaaS technology company and/or industry
2+ years experience working in research operations or research program management
2+ years of experience creating, managing, or actively using participant management platforms

Preferred qualifications

Proficiency using Google Suite / Workspace products
Familiarity with UX Research best practices
Can tactically address bottlenecks, blockers, and holding patterns in a way that results in optimal project completion times
Experience using other UX Research and ResOps platforms (e.g., Qualtrics, Ethnio, Respondent)
Can communicate and collaborate comfortably with relevant stakeholder groups (e.g., legal, security, compliance, data science, product management)

job_title: Global CSR, Social Impact Associate, Americas
summary: Implement Social Impact partnerships or programs across Americas (approximately 80% of your time) and provide expertise for key Global initiatives across…
job_description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

About the Team:
The Social Impact Associate, Americas will be an integral member of the Global Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) team at TikTok. This organization designs and implements the global sustainability and social impact strategy, working collaboratively across disciplines to bring the right resources, expertise, and experience to each aspect of Environmental Social Governance (ESG). Our team is growing and is seeking experienced, bright professionals to join us. In this role, you will be driving our Social Impact strategy and programs in Americas, in addition to supporting key Global Social Impact programs over time. The following describes the responsibilities and requirements.

Responsibilities:

Implement Social Impact partnerships or programs across Americas (approximately 80% of your time) and provide expertise for key Global initiatives across sustainability & social impact (approximately 20% of your time);
Support organizational vetting, partnerships design, and outcome measurement, ensuring all local and regional efforts roll up into our global goals;
Engage with key external stakeholders including non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and community based organizations (CBOs) that support the company's social impact goals;
Work cross-functionally with Global Public Policy, Operations, Product Teams, Communications, and Marketing, to prepare, deliver, and amplify key partnerships and programs.
Support regional or global "TikTokforGood" in-app social content campaigns, connecting these efforts to our overall sustainability & social impact and goals;
Serve as CSR resource for emergency/disaster response within region as needed, based on internal plan and processes, with pre-vetted NGO and CBO response partner organizations;
Represent CSR as an internal consultant and resource for other teams regarding our CSR strategy, initiatives, compliance and external reporting requirements, and guidance on NGO vetting and selection.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
5+ years experience in Social Responsibility programs.
Experience designing programs for a global company and workforce.
Knowledge of NGOs, the SDGs, social impact and corporate sustainability industry best practices.
Strong analytical skills with a high degree of attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to develop effective internal and external stakeholder networks.
Self-motivated individual that excels in a fast-paced environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

job_description:
Non-Union Position
IS Security & Analytics; Portland , Oregon (US-OR)
Regular FT
Posting # 3672

The Role:
You’ll be a member of the IT&S Compliance Team and will work closely with IT&S Security and other technical, non-technical teams as well as internal or external auditors. The primary purpose of this position is to ensure Information Technology & Services (IT&S) department is in compliance with state and federal regulations by creating, monitoring, evaluating, and reporting on the effectiveness of operational controls within Information Technology (IT) and Industrial Control System (ICS) environments. Day to Day:

Ensure company complies with all local, state and federal requirements (SOX, TSA pipeline security directives, etc.)
Develop and periodically review Operational controls related to compliance with federal and state pipeline security regulations.
Develop, maintain, and collaborate on compliance documentation. This requires coordination with other departments and contractors for the collection of compliance information.
Prepare for and assist with internal and external audits, periodically test operational controls, and document audit findings.
Review internal and external audit findings and prepare responses and recommendations to internal procedures and/or operational controls.
Implement the recommendations upon management approval.
Communicate best practices and lessons learned to Operations and Contractors.
Coordinate with various departments, and if necessary internal and external auditors, to ensure that requirements are met, and appropriate changes are made as needed. Come on your first day with:

Minimum of two years' IT, industrial control systems, or information security experience, additional years’ experience required for levels 2 or 3.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent additional work experience
ITIL Foundations certified or successful completion within 90 days of starting

Technical Competency
Understanding of IT or ICS systems, applications, networks and databases.
Knowledge of Operational Controls.
Understanding of assessing and designing internal and security controls.
Experience in developing and submitting audit and compliance reports to governing bodies, legal entities, and/or external authorities.
Knowledge of risk management practices and security governance programs.
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral).

Occupational Personality
You’ll interact with NW Natural's personnel at various levels and across business units to understand regulatory requirements.
Strong communication and facilitation skills will be key to your success. Excellent written and verbal communication skills will help you succeed, as will your ability to take raw data and generate compliance report for various levels of management.
Leadership abilities with the capability to direct other technical staff on security initiatives and guide team members
You’ll get to work with minimal supervision. Strong analytical skills to analyze compliance requirements and relate them to appropriate operational controls.
Your ability to manage expectations appropriately will help and build long-term relationships.
You’ll remain current with industry compliance best practices.

job_description:
Job Profile

Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Software Developer Associate within PNC's organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh PA.

Job Description

Assists in the development, testing, and implementation of software solutions.
Assists with designing software solutions.
Writes code, tests and deploys software.
Prepares technical and procedural documentation required for software.
Maintains and debugs software.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Application Design, Architecture – Knowledge of application design activities, tools and techniques; ability to utilize these to convert business requirements and logical models into a technical application design.

Application Development Tools – Knowledge of and ability to utilize a variety of specific tools and toolkits for the development and support of applications.

Application Maintenance – Knowledge of and ability to define, implement changes to, and support a production application.

Application Testing – Knowledge of application testing and ability to design, plan and execute application testing strategies and tactics to ensure software quality throughout all stages of application development.

System Development Life Cycle – Knowledge of project management techniques and the ability to plan, design, develop, test, implement and maintain system development life cycle segments and phases.

Technical Writing/Documentation – Knowledge of the technical language and writing approach, and the ability to write paper-based and on-line technical reference documentation (guidelines, standards, procedures, processes, applications, etc.)

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree with New to PNC .

The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.

job_title: newIT Helpdesk - Remote Services Triage Technician
summary: This role is accountable for creating, updating and resolving technical service requests from customers and with speed and precision.
job_description:
OBJECTIVE
The Remote Services Triage Technician will model the SUCCESS mission, vision, and values each day, functioning as a guide for daily accountabilities and responsibilities. This role is accountable for creating, updating and resolving technical service requests from customers and with speed and precision. This role is on the front line for Reactive client requests, handling with a high level of accuracy and customer satisfaction.

Reactive ticket work focus of triaging support calls/emails/alerts, first call resolution on level 0 and level 1 issues and on-going collaboration with other members of SUCCESS’s technical team when appropriate. Proactive ticket work focuses of performing routine maintenance/monitoring tasks, service support tasks and tasks as directed.

INITIAL TRIAGE ACCOUNTABILITIES (70%)
Phone support for helpdesk calls
Triaging/resolving service requests in an efficient, effective manner – avoiding mistakes and minimizing time per service request
Collaboration with peers and technical staff to aide in first call completion
Ensuring that remote support response standards are met on a consistent, day-to-day basis
Ensuring customer satisfaction with the resolution of each service request by confirming resolution upon completion of each service request
Collaboration with peers and technical staff to aide in transition of work to appropriate team
Following documented procedures, identifying gaps in documentation, and requesting that documentation be developed to bridge gaps
CLIENT NETWORK MONITORING ACCOUNTABILITIES (30%)
Create service requests when monitoring reveals, a need for technical intervention or correction and triage based on severity.
Deploy and maintain managed service offerings
Proactively maintaining client networks remotely, in accordance with documented standards
RESPONSIBILITIES
This role will demonstrate SUCCESS’s core values and culture through daily work and expectations
Perform service support tasks to aide technical operation team’s efficiency
Participating in internal efforts to continuously improve efficiency, profitability, technical competence and customer satisfaction
Performing non-routine technical tasks under the direction of a Lead/Manager
Performance matrix around call volume, response/resolution rate of level 0/1 issues, customer satisfaction and a minimum 60-65% utilization on a monthly basis
Create an accurate record of work performed according to SUCCESS standards and submit for approval weekly
Work closely with teammates to develop an exceptional Technical Operations department
(This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.)

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Recently completed an IT training program and/or actively pursuing a 2 or 4-year degree in an IT related field
Ability to triage technical support calls in a call center environment
Able to identify and respond to tickets according to priority
Ability to work quickly and accurately with attention to detail
Exceptional customer service skills and ability to articulate technical issues/resolutions in non-technical terms
Strong work ethic with an ability to meet deadlines with consistent time management skills
Experience following written procedures and documenting work
Willingness to “pitch in” as a member of the remote support team, to ensure that overall standards are consistently met
Fosters collaboration and team effectiveness within work group and across the organization
Experience following written procedures and documenting work
Effective verbal and written communications to a business audience and/or peers
