job_description:
Description / Position Overview

IT Systems and M365 Administrator Solutions Engineer (IT Solutions Engineer)
In this position, you will ensure IT (Information Technology) solutions meet the business requirements and needs of the City. You will ensure delivered solutions are secure, align with business goals and needs, support a common operating environment and user interaction model, use supported City technology platforms, and deliver quality and scale. Solutions engineering include networking, systems and applications, general hardware and infrastructure, security, backup, recovery and archiving, and data storage.

You will work closely with the IT BRM (Business Relationship Manager) to ensure a clear requirement is documented and understood to create a valid and business-accepted solution while ensuring IT and its customers receive optimized business value from IT investments.

Colorado Springs is One of the Best Places to Live according to

Learn_About_the_City (Download PDF reader)
(This information may change annually).

Essential Job Functions - the basic job duties an employee must be able to perform:
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 suite, Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Power Shell, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, and Power apps
Work independently to take on projects requiring network and cyber engineering across multiple IT technical areas
Research, analyze, and resolve highly complex problems using a significant application of technical knowledge, conceptualizing, reasoning and interpretation
Support and develop highly innovative strategic plans and solutions
Work as a team member or lead efforts
Integrate industry experience and deep professional/technical knowledge
Break down highly complex technical topics into language and diagrams understandable by the requesting business unit and executive sponsors
Investigate and consume the technical details of multiple IT hardware and software platforms and incorporate them into technical solution designs
Conceptualize, model, design, and effectively communicate solutions
Develop solutions that are appropriate to the opportunity at hand in terms of simplicity, cost, and supportability
Operate in an IT Service Management, specifically ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library) based environment
Communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing, with users and technical support
Serve as the ultimate escalation point for technical support
Resolve problems in a timely manner; gather and analyze information skillfully; doesn’t stop at the first answer, investigate the issue thoroughly
Listen to the needs of each customer and clearly share their needs with the appropriate group
Balance team and individual responsibilities; provide and welcome constructive feedback; contribute to the group with a positive attitude
Assist with improvement of IT processes focusing on quality: Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness with tasks; look for ways to improve our processes always focusing on quality; apply feedback to improve performance
We are looking for candidates who demonstrate:

Knowledge of and experience with:
Managing the Office 365 interface and performing technical tasks related to the engineering and configuration of domains, security groups, users, and licenses
Exchange Administration: Responsible for engineering and configuring the settings for user mailboxes and e-mail, including the settings required for connectivity with Outlook
Teams and OneDrive Administration: Responsible for all engineering and configuration and support of Teams and OneDrive functionality
Configure and engineer Azure Active Directory and Exchange policies
Migration of data into the Office 365 cloud platform
Engineer and implement tenant and AD policies related to user access, risk and compliance, security controls (e.g., MFA), and alerts to monitor for specific activities; monitor and action alerts
Establish and perform O365 best practices for providing fit-for-purpose, stable, and secure environment
Engineer, test, and deploy, solutions through the use of Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager
Perform other related duties as required
Managing deployments/rollouts
Bash, PowerShell, and Python scripting ability
Microsoft Endpoint Manager & Microsoft Configuration Manager
Windows client environments, including both hardware and software, at an advanced or expert level
Experience with Azure, Active Directory, Group Policy, and O365
Proficient in one or more modern, general-purpose scripting languages, especially PowerShell
Strong experience in configuration management, Teams Collaboration Suite, SharePoint Online Services, and Microsoft Exchange Online configuration and security
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly present ideas at all levels to achieve the required results
Ability to:
Assist in the configuration and use of the Microsoft Teams Collaboration Suite and SharePoint Online services,
Provide subject matter expertise in the deployment and support of SharePoint Online environment under the Enterprise Collaboration Infrastructure Services,
Implement and manage Microsoft Exchange Online (EXO) configuration and security,
Architect, design, implement, and manage Office 365 Security and Compliance Center, including configuring and deploying Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Records Management and Retention, e-Discovery, and Threat management,
Provide technical services in managing Microsoft EXO Services
Provide technical services in developing custom workflows and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) within Office 365 and Azure Active Directory (AAD) to accommodate scoped service requests,
Provide expert technical services in architecting, designing, implementing, and operational management of Office 365’s Security and Compliance Center
Communicate effectively both orally and in writing to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with persons in the course of performing assigned duties, including management and outside business associates
Work independently or with minimal supervision
Organize and prioritize workflow and meet established timeframes and deadlines
Strong attention to detail with excellent follow-up
Work under pressure within tight timeframes and deadlines
Solve problems
Be responsible and accountable
Act with customers in mind; dedicated to meeting and exceeding internal and external customer expectations
Completes tasks accurately and on time; follows policy and procedure guidelines

Successful candidate will have
A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in computer science, network engineering, information management, or a related field
Three years of full-time professional end-to-end solution development experience across a wide range of hardware and software technologies and sourced services
Possess, or obtain within six months of hire, CompTIA Security+ and ITIL Foundations certifications
Possess, or obtain within six months of hire, Microsoft 365 Certified Administrator, Azure Administrator or equivalent certifications
Possess, or obtain upon hire and maintain, a valid, non-probationary Colorado driver’s license not subject to restriction related to alcohol and/or drug violations or pending charges
One (1) year of the appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for each required year of post-high school education.

Additional appropriate education may be substituted for the minimum experience requirements.

Ideal candidates will also have
Solution delivery experience within a state, county, or city government environment
Application technical solution engineering experience within a Microsoft environment
Demonstrated understanding of network designs, topologies, both transport and security
Virtualization and/or storage experience
Certified as a Microsoft 365 or Microsoft Azure Engineer
Expertise with one or more of the following: Microsoft Developer, DevOps, Administrator, Security or Data engineering
Design/Architect IT solutions around Microsoft Office365 and Microsoft Azure systems
Previous government experience leading an Office 365 Support Team in all facets of the integration and deployment of products and services
Additional Information
The background check process for this position may include being fingerprinted.
The City of Colorado Springs offers additional compensation depending on the position, area of assignment, and specific job assignments, including shift differential, pay differential, acting or lead, special assignment, hazard pay, longevity, cell phone allowance, uniform allowance, relocation, awards, standby, call out, compensatory time off, tuition, overtime, extra duty, incentive, holiday premium, proficiency, and vacation sell back.

summary:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience in program/project management.
Experience as a people manager.
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
7 years of experience in program/project management
Experience as a people manager
Experience with presentations and written communications
Preferred qualifications:

5 years of threat assessment experience.
Experience with conflict resolution and de-escalation.
Knowledge of Google Workspace products.
Ability to remain solution-driven and persistent in leading cross-functional project teams without formal authority in a rapidly-changing environment.
Solid analytical skills, including the ability to analyze a variety of data, determine validity, draw concise conclusions, and make recommendations.
Exceptional communication and relationship-building skills, and effective at building trust with executive leaders.
About the job
As a Program Manager within Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS), you will work in a fast-paced environment managing and solving various complex projects in an efficient and collaborative way. You will blend passion with determination to support the rapidly evolving security and resilience space, helping Googlers understand the importance of physical security, business continuity, and more. You will collaborate and support high performing teams spread across the globe.
From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.

Additional Information

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $162,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
Responsibilities
Hire, develop, and retain team talent.
Manage a team of workplace violence threat assessment case managers, overseeing interviews, assessment methodologies, management actions, and mitigation strategies.
Collaborate and build consensus with a variety of teams across Alphabet on threat assessment and violence prevention, sharing knowledge and leveraging assets efficiently and effectively and ensure compliance with regulations internal and external to Google.
Identify threat assessment and management gaps and prepare detailed specifications for collection while managing multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines.
Initiate, execute and maintain relationships inside and outside the organization.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

The Lifecyle Management team in the Information Technology and Records Management (ITRM) Division of Health and Human Services is seeking an IT Software Developer. This includes involvement in the architecture, design, maintenance, and enhancements of custom applications to meet the business needs of the department. As a member of a Kanban team, responsibilities will include software enhancement, support, and maintenance.
New employees who are hired into remote or hybrid positions between January 2, 2022 to December 31, 2024, will receive $500 toward the cost of establishing consistent internet connectivity, payable upon completion of 6 months of employment.
Location and hours:
Currently, this position is remote due to COVID-19. Once the COVID-19 emergency declaration is lifted, this position will be located on-site at the Hennepin County Government Center, 300 South 6th Street, Minneapolis, MN 55487. While temporarily designated as remote, workers may be required to come on-site an average of 0 to 12 days a year for work meetings, trainings, or for any other reasons that their supervisor may deem necessary (may include additional days for onboarding and new employee training). Supervisors will provide as much advance notice as practicable. Work hours will typically be Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

About this position type:
This is a full-time, benefit-earning position.

Effective September 1, 2021, all new job offers are conditional based on the candidate being fully vaccinated for COVID-19. “Fully vaccinated” means 14 days after receiving the second dose in a two-dose vaccination series approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on a full or emergency-use basis, or 14 days after receiving a single-dose vaccine approved by the FDA on a full or emergency-use basis. After a conditional job offer is made, the candidate must show proof of full vaccination prior to their start date. A COVID-19 vaccination card from the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a vaccination record from your doctor’s office, or a personal digital vaccination record constitutes sufficient “proof.” The candidate must also attest they are vaccinated by completing a form on the first day of employment. Reasonable accommodations to this vaccination requirement will be considered upon request by a candidate for medical or religious reasons as required by applicable law.

In this position, you will:
Primarily focus on enhancement, support, and maintenance of newly developed applications that are based on .NET, C#, Angular, Typescript, PrimeNG, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, SASS, REST APIs, SQL Server, etc., and deployed to Azure Cloud Infrastructure.
Support legacy ASP.NET Web Forms and ASP.NET MVC applications.
Participate in eliciting functional and security requirements, as a prerequisite to enhancing and maintaining applications.
Work with various teams (Business, Development, Security, Operations, etc.).
Participate in Code Reviews.
Write necessary documentation.
Promote and follow software engineering best practices and standards.
Participate in Team Kanban meetings (right to left), planning meetings, and other events related to application development, maintenance, and replacement.
Need to have:
One of the following:
Two-year college/vocational technical degree in a technology field.
An approved information technology certificate.
Completion of five college/vocational technical technology courses.
Completion of approved IT Hennepin County internship and one year or more of information technology experience.
Bachelor's degree in a technology field.
Two years or more of technology experience.
Nice to have:
Experience with:
Database design and management using MS SQL Server.
Entity Framework, LINQ to Entities, and OData.
Software Engineering based on .NET, C#, Angular, HTML5, CSS3, SASS, SCSS, JavaScript, Typescript, OOAD (Object Oriented Analysis and Design) concepts, and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming).
Developing and consuming REST APls using the .NET framework
Source control using GIT.
Deploying Solutions to Azure Cloud Infrastructure and Using Azure Cloud based resources such as Azure databases, and computing resources such as App Services.
Participating in peer code review exercises.
Application Security and Secure Coding.
Mobile-first and Responsive Web design and development.
Knowledge of:
User experience (UX) design.
Web Accessibility.
Internationalization and Localization.
Ability to:
Use creative problem-solving techniques when confronted with issues.
Provide excellent customer service and interact effectively with end users.
Work collaboratively with managers, customers, and other developers.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization.
About the department:
Human Services delivers a variety of services to individuals or families that assist with basic needs or encourage client change around specific objectives. We work with individuals as well as systems and communities in order to develop policy and advocate for the people we serve. The people we serve and our communities are connected. By helping one, we help the other.

About Hennepin County:

Hennepin is the largest county government organization in Minnesota. Our employees work every day to improve the health, safety and quality of life for our residents and communities. All of our jobs align to one or more of our overarching goals - that Hennepin County residents are healthy, protected and safe, self-reliant, assured due process, and mobile.

Our employees receive a combination of generous benefits and positive workplace culture not found at other organizations. This includes meaningful work that impacts our community, competitive pay, work-life balance, a variety of benefits and opportunities to grow. Learn more at www.hennepin.us/employees.

summary: The Junior Storage Administrator is responsible for supporting the day-to-day operations and maintenance of storage hardware and software.
job_description:
Description:

ABOUT US
At Connectria, LLC, we provide award-winning Cloud Computing and Managed Hosting from our world-class data centers in North America to more than 1,000 customers in 30+ countries throughout the world, and we help customers run their systems securely in Amazon’s AWS cloud and Microsoft’s Azure cloud.
For over twenty years, Connectria’s ‘No Jerks Allowed’ philosophy has been the foundation of our culture. We are a company that believes in promoting from within and take an employee-first approach. Due to these practices, Connectria has won St. Louis Post-Dispatch Best Places to Work 9 times, Computerworld Best Places to Work in IT 8 times, The Nation’s Best and Brightest in Wellness Award, and HIRE Vets Medallion Award.
If you are looking for your next career opportunity and enjoy working in a fast-paced and growing business environment and want to be on a team with a “No Jerks Allowed” company philosophy that treats everyone with respect in a fun and supportive work environment, Connectria has an exciting opportunity for you!
POSITION PROFILE
The Junior Storage Administrator is responsible for supporting the day-to-day operations and maintenance of storage hardware and software. This position is responsible for the provisioning of new storage and provides technical support and subject matter expertise for all storage software and devices. This job participates in an on-call rotation responsible for after-hours high priority incidents, service requests and changes. An Ideal candidate must have a strong storage administration background.
Key Responsibilities
Monitor existing storage environments for utilization, performance, and availability
Provide capacity planning, forecast pipelining of storage growth and determine allocation to different storage tiers
Perform new product evaluations and drive vendor testing
Responsible for planning and execution of new storage installations and upgrades
Perform any host level tasks to ensure access to storage
Manage disk, tape, switching and storage hardware and software solutions
Perform Data Migrations
Setup and monitor storage replication environments
Other responsibilities as assigned
. Requirements:

Required Skills & Requirements:
Bachelors Degree with course work in computer science or management information systems preferred or- an equivalent combination of education and job-related work experience to equal 5 - 10 years of Information Technology work.
Experience with storage systems including Network Appliance Filer, Dell EqualLogic, Dell Compellent, Dell PowerVault, as well as storage area network design and operation.
Solid problem determination and resolution skills as well as strong communication skills both written and verbally.
A committed and self-motivated individual with ability to work off hours (nights or weekends) for upgrades and support as needed.
The ideal candidate will possess experience with the following technologies:
Working knowledge of iSCSI, NFS and fiber channel SAN and cloud architectures
Advanced technical knowledge of storage management best practices and procedures, related hardware/software, and backup
Advanced technical knowledge and skills of the installation, support, and maintenance of SAN, NAS, backup to disk technologies, virtual tape library infrastructure and associated software products
Knowledge of fiber channel protocols, TCP/IP protocols, and SAN management, automation, and resource management
Knowledge of storage optimization techniques for technologies such as storage virtualization, thin provisioning, or de-duplication
Extensive knowledge of a multi-tiered distributed architecture, including LAN/WAN concepts, TCP/IP, DNS and firewalls is required
Experience with server and network systems including VMware
Advanced knowledge of analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance techniques in the support of large, complex multi-platform storage environments
Skills to review and clarify user requirements, evaluate new technologies, design and coordinate the implementation of complex storage configurations to address new user requirements, ability to provide technical justifications used to acquire and exploit new technologies
Ability to collaborate with other team members, and members of other groups, ability to influence others and gain support for ideas and action plans
The ability to think strategically and attain goals by engaging other staff members and other groups within the organization
Independently evaluates and analyzes ways to optimize current environment, also provides analysis and recommendations on future storage requirements.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
The opportunity to work with one of the fastest growing companies in the country with an award winning culture! Rated as the Best Place to Work, Connectria offers a generous benefits package that you would expect from a large company with the relaxed family-oriented atmosphere of a small company.
We offer an excellent compensation with generous benefits including:
100% employer paid benefit premiums including medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability and life insurance
401(k) plan with guaranteed employer contribution
Paid vacation time
Paid holidays
Paid parental leave
Free identity theft coverage
Paid certification training and completion awards
Online wellness rewards
Free personal trainers
Free gym memberships
And much more!
Job Type: Full-time, Direct Hire
Work Remotely: Yes
Work Authorization:
Connectria, LLC will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Connectria, LLC is an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration of employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, martial status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Position Description
The IT Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical assistance to attorneys and staff which supports the Firm's technology hardware and software applications, including troubleshooting computer, printer problems, and mobile devices such as iPhones and IPads. Using a support ticketing application to update and close issues worked on. Participate in multiple often simultaneous IT projects. Assist with inventory tracking. Configure desktops, laptops, displays, printers, telephones, mobile devices (e.g., iPhone, iPad).

Provide technical support for conference room setups and video conference meetings.

Provide courteous and timely assistance for service tickets escalated from the Firm's third-party help desk service provider or as requested by the local office IT Manager.

Monitor for emails addressed to DC IT and respond accordingly.

On an as-needed basis, participate in projects that may include replacing hardware ( e.g., PC's, laptops, handhelds and printers).

Provide support during and after building power shutdowns, etc.

Assist firm engineers in testing software applications, new desktop images, and applications.

Provide first and second level support on desktop applications.

Other duties as required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Must Have:
Excellent interpersonal skills for interaction with co-workers, management, legal, and administrative staff.

Ability to speak and write clearly and concisely.

Complete command of the English language and above average verbal communication skills for interaction with attorneys and legal support staff.

No less than 3 years of previous experience in desktop support role. Qualified candidates should have experience with and proficient with MS Office Applications, Microsoft Windows 10, iOS, as well as other legal industry technology, tools, and applications.

Meticulous, detailed, and organized.

Experience with MacOS, OneLogin, Duo, Litera Innova, ChangePro, NetDocuments, Teams, Zoom, ShareFile, Office 365, and conference room audio video equipment.

Education and Certification

summary:
Install, support, and maintain PC and Mac hardware including servers, desktops, notebooks, monitors, and printers.
Support anti-virus and backup systems.
job_description:
Summary

Meta, Google, Cisco, FedEx, Amazon, American Express, PayPal, Mazda, Walmart, Honda, Genentech. . . all these companies rely on AnswerLab's research to support key business and product decisions. We are a growing leader in a rapidly growing industry and we’re looking for a full-time IT Support Administrator in our New York Office to support the technical operations of our business.


Job Purpose

The IT Support Administrator is responsible for supporting the technical operations of the business, ensuring both employee and client needs are met efficiently and effectively.
Job Responsibilities

Respond to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically (Tier 1)
Identify and elevate tickets to IT Systems and InfoSec Teams as necessary.
Support the IT Systems Team with new projects and initiatives
Install, support, and maintain PC and Mac hardware including servers, desktops, notebooks, monitors, and printers.
Lead and innovate employee technical onboarding and offboarding process (laptop provisioning, training, de-provisioning).
Support software and web-based platforms (Office365, Slack, Google, Box.com, Okta, Zoom, etc.).
Support anti-virus and backup systems.
Setup and maintain email accounts, Azure Active Directory user accounts and distribution lists
Document processes, procedures, training guides, and issue resolutions.
Maintain software and hardware inventory.
Maintain and document special procedures and policies outlined in our client MSA’s to ensure compliance.
Maintain high-security standards and processes to support our ISO 27001 compliance and SOC2 reporting.
Support the InfoSec team with ISO 27001 and SOC 2 audits as needed.
Provide support for Android and iOS devices.
Participate in after-hours upgrades and troubleshooting as needed.
Remain current on developing technologies and make recommendations as needed to IT management
Assist our AV Coordinators. AV Coordinators support the technical aspects of our research studies whether conducted in our research labs, offsite or remote.

Key Relationships

Reports to the Director of IT & Operations
Works closely with employees, clients, vendors, and study participants
This job has no supervisory responsibilities


Knowledge, Skills and Experience

We understand that outstanding candidates can come from a variety of backgrounds. While specific experience is important, we are ultimately looking for candidates who have the personal characteristics to thrive in a growing client-focused business. The ideal candidate will likely meet many or most of the job criteria listed below.

Minimum three years of experience in Information Technology, Help Desk, or other IT related positions.
Proficient with Windows/Mac hardware, Windows/Mac OS, Cloud phone systems, active directory, mobile devices (Apple, Android), web conferencing services, and other related hardware and software platforms.
Experience with Azure Active Directory and Office 365 and Zoom.
Proficient with security software and principles such as Endpoint Protection, Software Firewalls, Patch and Vulnerability Management.
Experience with SSO and MDM services a plus
Proficient with networking (WAN, LAN, DMZ, VPN, VLAN), Wireless (WPA2/8021.x) and HA firewalls.
Experience with Windows server maintenance and upgrades.
Must understand basic audio-visual principles.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment that requires time management, task prioritization, and ability to identify problems and work toward solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to produce coherent and organized documentation.
Track record of operating independently, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner.
Must be available to be on-call for infrequent after-hours emergencies.
A healthy sense of humour and a fun personality
Must be able to lift 50 lbs.
Travel required up to 10%.


In addition to expertly meeting the requirements outlined above, your success will be measured on our eight Core Values:
Core Values:

Build trust
Provide amazing service
Support and Encourage Inclusivity
Jump in to help others
Handle change with flexibility
Innovate our products and processes
Explore Creative Solutions to Challenges
Make AnswerLab a great place to work


Physical Requirements

Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines.
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other devices and objects.


Note: This job description is subject to change at any time.

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.
At AnswerLab, our mission is to create experiences people love. This means we strive to make our company a great place to work for people from all walks of life. Hiring people from a wide variety of backgrounds makes our company stronger and helps us achieve our mission.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

job_description:
Posting Number PG191506EP

Internal Recruitment No

Working Title IT Systems Administrator II

Anticipated Hiring Range $99,000- $109,000

Work Schedule Monday - Friday 8a-5p, with overtime and weekends as necessary

Job Location Raleigh, NC

Department Computing Services - College of Management

About the Department
Our primary goal: is to have an IT structure and services that will move the college’s mission forward by supporting faculty, staff, and students in addressing the grand challenges of business with a large breadth of competencies. A successful IT structure would demonstrate the below.
 Ensure Customer Success – Exceptional and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and action.
Strive for Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.
Disciplined Approach – Thorough knowledge of systems and available resources for faculty, staff, and students.
Solution-Oriented – Able to devise creative approaches to complex system integration while minimizing customer impact
Performance Metric Based – Utilization of metrics to monitor and enhance performance while searching for continuous improvement and ensuring exceptional, efficient, and effective services.


Essential Job Duties
This position reports to the Director of IT of the Poole College of Management and provides system IT support and services which includes technical planning, implementation, and academic support for the faculty, staff, and students in the Pool College of Management. The incumbent will work to reduce the overall burden on the faculty, researchers, and IT support staff by serving as an expert in technical analysis to provide a comprehensive understanding of the technical requirements needed to work in close consultation and collaboration with outside service providers and within the North Carolina State University Office of Information Technology (OIT); with a primary focus on providing cost-effective solutions which leverage existing university infrastructure and services as well as available cloud computing platforms. Areas include faculty/staff offices, classrooms, student computing labs, and meeting spaces. Supported software includes operating systems, office suite, lab software, and others. Hardware includes Windows-based and Apple-based desktops, laptops, netbooks, and tablets; smartphones, office phones; printers, copiers, and others.

Position requires some evening work and occasional weekends. The position is required to be part of a rotation working at our location at Research Triangle Park (RTP) to support evening classes.

Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Technical Knowledge (60%):
Providing a high level of technical support (development, testing, integration, and implementation) of Cloud computing (AWS, MS Azure, Google Utils), applications, and interfaces that deliver IT tools in support of the academic and teaching needs.
Developing and maintaining clear, understandable documentation to describe program development and modification, as well as troubleshooting.
 Updating system and support documentation as necessary to reflect changes to programs, solutions, reports, and interfaces.
Performing project management, requirements definitions, systems design, analysis, code development, problem resolution, and vendor coordination.
Updating management, customers, and others as appropriate on a timely basis regarding progress on assigned tasks, projects, and issues, via written or oral reports
Assisting other IT teams with selection and providing a technical evaluation of products/tools to ensure that the proposed solution adheres to enterprise-wide requirements, adapts to new requirements, and changes technologies to meet business standardization protocols and objectives.
Providing guidance to Applications System Analysts to ensure best practices, standard methodologies, and processes are executed.
Providing consultation and expertise to management, faculty, and staff to develop solutions to the college computing environment using industry-standard and custom tools.
Functioning as a technical consultant to the Poole College of Business and maintaining high service levels.
Participating in system-wide initiatives to improve efficiency and reach institutional goals and objectives.


Technical Solution Development (20%):
Applying best practices to the management of the information system life cycle.
Analyzing customer requirements; researching, designing, acquiring, and implementing innovative systems solutions that are sustainable.
Coordinating and operationalizing simple to complex projects with direction from the Director of IT.
Identifying areas for process improvement and procedural improvements.
Providing detailed specifications describing functions to be automated.
Responding to end-user requests via ServiceNow for issue resolution and works to resolve problems quickly and accurately.
Assisting with enhancement requests of end-users, documentation, and prioritization as well as efforts to reduce waste, find efficiencies and promote best practices.
Making oral and written presentations to project teams, management, and other departments.
Integrating advanced knowledge of Active Directory, Windows 7, Windows 10, System Center Configuration Manager, Windows Deployment Services, AdminStudio, and software applications used in the Poole COM (accounting, economics research, statistical packages, and others) to develop, deploy, configure, and maintain college-wide operating systems and software packages.
Researching, developing, and implementing solutions to issues as they arise.
Operating systems are planned, configured, deployed, and maintained in both the Active Directory (AD) and standalone environments using Windows Deployment Services (WDS) and System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM). System network settings are configured and maintained in the enterprise IPAM database. Applications are planned, configured, deployed, and maintained for distribution through AD and SCCM.


Technical Support (20%):
Proficient in Windows OS, Windows Server, Mac OS, and Linux deployment, management, and testing. Locally and using enterprise tools integrating with university identity management (IDM) tools (AD or Shibboleth)
Taking ownership and facilitate technical bridge during an operational disruption in service or service outages.
Ensuring minutes, action items, and resolution steps are documented and distributed to the Director of IT. Implements permanent fixes to eliminate repeat outages/incidents
Continuing research, support, and personal education to maintain technical skillset ensuring the continued advanced support for all aspects of the university and the Poole College of Business supported operating systems, hardware, mobile, and IOT devices
Facilitating access, manage, and maintain storage needs both on-premise and cloud storage


Other Responsibilities
Other related duties as assigned.

Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a technology-related field
Minimum of 7 years IT server and desktop support experience, preferably within an academic environment


Other Required Qualifications
Ability to work with limited supervision in a team environment
Experience with image creation and deployment; software installations and packaging as well as; troubleshooting computer hardware and software
Results oriented, organized, efficient and self-motivated
Exceptional customer service skills with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Insatiable appetite to learn new technologies and overcome technical challenges
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications and Google Education suite
Experience with multiple operating systems and server systems including Windows OS, Mac OSX, Windows Server, VMware, VCM’s, Software Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience with network management, security management, risk assessment
Proficient with cloud computing solutions and management tools (MS Azure, AWS, Google Utils)
Results oriented, organized, efficient, and incredibly driven with an insatiable appetite to learn new technologies and overcome technical challenges
Excellent analytical and communication skills, the ability to work well in a team environment, and demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple tasks simultaneously


Preferred Qualifications
Experience with IOS and Windows tablet devices
Experience using and troubleshooting with SQL, XML, and Unix scripting
Programming experience
Desktop and software virtualization



Certifications (Preferred but not required):
AWS Cloud practitioner
VMware


Required License(s) or Certification(s)
N/A

Valid NC Driver's License required No

Commercial Driver's License required No

Anticipated Close Date Open until filled.

Proven capability in writing documentation
A good understanding IT Technologies

Proven communication skills are essential in this role

NuProbe USA is hiring one IT Specialist for its Houston (TX) location. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join the NuProbe family in the General Administrative Department reporting directly to the Director of Operations.

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

As the company is growing quickly, the demand of IT support has been tremendouly increased. The successful candidate will be able to join the fast track promotion process offered by the company and will be the potential team leader for future IT team of the company.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Essential responsibilities and duties include, but are not limited to the following:

Main point of contact for technical support of IT hardware and software applications in office.

Coordinate with HR and managers to support employee onboarding process.


Provision, maintain and trouble shoot Mac/PC laptops, desktops, tablets, printers, scanners and Audio/Video equipment, including infrastructure and systems in conference rooms and labs.

Mange and maintain operating system updates, security updates, software and driver updates to corporate devices.

Prioritize, schedule, and complete IT support requests in a timely and efficient manner, including documenting all the steps that were taken to resolve issues.

Manage and maintenance IT related asset/inventory, including both hardware and software.

Develop training materials/guidance and lead technical training sessions on corporate hardware operation, software applications, and OS.

Support laboratory manager to design implement and maintain secure laboratory information management system (LIMS).

Support and work with regulatory affairs manager to ensure company's information systems/infrastructure is aligned with regulatory rules and protocols.


Job Qualifications and Education:

Bachelor's degree in Information technology, computer science or equivalent
Extensive knowledge in support of various operations systems (MacOS/IOS/IPadOS/Windows/Linux)
Subject matter expertise in network design, network topology/engineering, information support.
Customer service experience & excellent communication skills.
Experience working in IT support field in FDA regulatory industry / biotech / pharmaceutical / healthcare company or environment is preferred.
Experience of implementing and/or supporting business information system in clinical laboratory settings, or life science research is preferred


SALARY AND BENEFITS

Targeted: 10% bonus

Competitive benefits: Health/dental/vision, 401k, 401k matching, LTD, life insurance, employee stock option plan, etc.


This job description describes the major responsibilities of the job. It does not include all aspects of the position, such as the potential additional duties assigned by management, and the requirement for flexibility in assisting others for the company's overall benefit.


About NuProbe USA:
NuProbe is a genomics company with proprietary technology to reduce the cost and improve the sensitivity of NGS by 100-fold. NuProbe's technologies have been featured in journals such as Nature Biomedical Engineering, Nature Chemistry, Cancer Discovery, and Nature Communications, in collaboration with collaborators from MD Anderson, Baylor College of Medicine, Thermo Fisher, Oxford Nanopore, and Microsoft Research. To date, NuProbe has raised more than $60M, and its US office based in Houston, TX has over 50 full-time employees. NuProbe's senior management team includes industry veterans from Adaptive Biotechnologies, Thermo Fisher, Nanostring, Roche, and Allergan.

summary: Specialized technologies such as applications, tools, systems and/or databases, configurations and commands, network protocols, desktop operating systems and…
job_description:
Summary
THIS POSITION IS TERM-LIMITED-TEMPORARY AND ANTICIPATED TO LAST THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2022. THIS POSITION IS BENEFITS-ELIGIBLE.

The COVID-19 pandemic affected the court's operations resulting in pending cases and increased workloads. King County Superior Court is seeking a temporary IT Systems Specialist to provide support in this important work and to ensure access to justice.

The responsibilities of this position include developing and enhancing systems and performing complex systems analysis, design, planning, and implementation of information technology (IT) systems. The incumbent may oversee or coordinate with other groups, outside agencies, or consultant contracts for information technology services. The incumbent may serve as project or team lead on projects; manage multiple platforms and operating systems; coordinate and provide training and instruction services for end users.

Who may apply: This position is open to all qualified applicants.

Work location: The primary work location for this position is at the King County Courthouse in downtown Seattle. The incumbent may be required to work at other facilities as assigned.

Work schedule and terms: The workweek for this position is normally Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Variations in these hours may occur. This at-will Term-Limited-Temporary position is exempt from the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act, and is not overtime-eligible.

Additional materials required: Please include a resume and cover letter describing how you meet or exceed the requirements for this position. These materials are supplemental to your application. You must still completely fill out the on-line application with your relevant education and work experience. Your application may be rejected as incomplete if you include relevant information only on the resume or cover letter, or if you reference "see resume" on your application.

Please note that you can attach multiple documents to your application. Your options are:
1) Copy and paste one or more documents into the text resume section of the application.
2) Attach multiple documents/files in the resume attachment section.
Job Duties
The following duties are not intended to represent the entire functional capacity of the position at the task level.
Identify, design, plan and implement complex and specialized hardware and software needs. Research and recommend hardware and software, and develop purchase justifications. Perform tests and evaluate new products.
Oversee and coordinate contact with other groups and outside agencies to provide information technology services; oversee on-going or major consultant contracts for IT services.
Manage multiple platforms and operating systems. Participate in formulating IT policies and procedures.
Diagnose and resolve routine and advanced end user systems and application problems locally and remotely in a multiple operating systems environment.
Serve as lead of subordinate staff, and as technical lead on projects. Plan and implement complex projects for assigned systems.
Maintain database of hardware and software inventory and manage deployment of equipment.
Maintain server environment and document all systems configurations. Serve as backup to staff responsible for managing security systems, virus protection, data backup and recovery and network tools.
Coordinate and provide training and instruction services for end users.
Monitor and analyze end user support services to assess effectiveness of services provided, identify and implement process improvements.
Follow up to ensure effective problem resolution for escalated/referred unresolved problems with appropriate specialized IT staff and/or vendors.
May be called upon to provide support for service issues or failures at any time.
Perform other duties of a similar nature and level.
Experience, Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent degree and three (3) years of related technical experience in IT systems support; or five (5) years of direct technical experience in IT systems support.

Must be able to work in a team environment and have demonstrable troubleshooting and customer service skills. Must have experience in configuring and maintaining complex technology systems. Must be able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Able to convey technical information to non-technical users. Able write and understand technical documentation, including developing complex application requirements.

Advanced knowledge of:
Information technology systems, principles and techniques.
Specialized technologies such as applications, tools, systems and/or databases, configurations and commands, network protocols, desktop operating systems and applications.
Local area networks and related systems, hardware and software installations and configuration, systems integration, wide-area network connectivity.
Audio/video conferencing, visual presentation systems, and digital recording systems.
Supplemental Information
Necessary special requirements: The ability to reliably travel throughout the County is required. Finalists are subject to the Washington State Patrol criminal background check and a reference check. Criminal background records are not automatically disqualifying.

As of December 6, 2021, King County Superior Court employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Your response to questions regarding vaccination status will be reviewed as part of Superior Court' hiring process.

Selection process: Application materials will be screened for qualifications and the most competitive candidates will be invited for interviews.

Union membership: This position is not represented by a union.

King County Superior Court is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.
No person is unlawfully excluded from employment opportunities based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including gender identify, sexual orientation and pregnancy), age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or other protected class. Our EEO policy applies to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, selection for training, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation.

If you have questions regarding this position, please call King County Superior Court Human Resources at (206) 477-1536.

Job Overview:
The IT Support Specialist will report directly to the Director of Information Technology. This position is responsible for assisting with the daily upkeep of the Chicago Fire data and telecom networks with a specific focus on providing support on event days. The IT Support Specialist will also be charged with setting up and maintaining computer hardware, software, and telecom for Fire staff. Listed below are the responsibilities and qualifications expected of this position.

 Set up client workstations, applications, and phones for Chicago Fire staff.
Troubleshoot problems with network, peripheral and end-point devices.
Assist with event execution; responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Pre-event planning and set-up of equipment, audio visual, broadcast, internet connections, etc.
Assist with technology needs and issues during event.
Post-event tear-down and cleanup.
Complete projects supporting the execution plan of the IT Department.
Implement facility and club rules, regulations, policies, and procedures.
Perform administrative duties including data backups, inventory, documentation, research and development of new IT initiatives.

 Attend and work various Chicago Fire games and key events.
Some travel to various offices and events is required.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree required, a concentration in computer science preferred.
 2+ years of relevant work experience.
Knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 2012 server, Office applications and active directory.
Knowledge of MAC OS is a plus.
Well organized, deadline orientated, and demonstrate an ability to manage multiple projects with autonomy.
Self-motivated and directed, with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Must be able to lift and transport heavy to moderately heavy objects, such as computers, monitors, and peripherals.
Demonstrate excellent customer service, and positive attitude.
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to effectively work with a large and diverse population.

summary: Learn more about our values and what it's like to be a member of our team on our website or by following us on Instagram @Worksighted (http://www.instagram.com…
job_description:
Who We Are:
Worksighted is one of the fastest-growing IT service providers in Michigan. We work hard, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. We are committed to growth, both our customers' and our own. As a team, we know we're only as good as the values we stand for and the hard work we put in every day. Joining our team means being a unique piece to the puzzle and a superhero in your own way. From crucial benefits like paid parental leave to in-office parties and zombie-themed wellness challenges, we work hard, have a lot of fun, and know what matters most to our people.
We are looking for a IT Security Specialist who will be responsible for monitoring our clients' environments for security issues and addressing these issues accordingly. This person will work closely with our Security Team and Remote Systems Engineers to ensure our clients have a strong security posture.
Who You Are:
You have a Bachelor's degree in IS, IT, Cyber Security, or related field.
You have at least 2-3 years of experience in IT.
You have a security certification (i.e. CompTIA Network+ or Security+) or 1 year of experience in a security-focused role.
You have a customer-first orientation and the ability to communicate effectively in potentially difficult situations.
What You're Accountable For:
Assisting with security monitoring and incident response, helping to develop new processes and documentation around security.
Conducting initial triage of issues from the Security service board.
Monitoring Worksighted's Security Essentials, including ATP, MFA, dark web, KnowBe4, etc.
Assisting with security tickets at the Client Services level, resolving basic issues and observing solutions to higher level issues for continued learning.
Reporting, tracking, and addressing potential threats to client environments.
Learning how to establish baseline security environments for clients and monitoring as needed.
Updating clients on the status of their security tickets and updating ticket documentation.
Assisting Security Specialist Team Lead with security-related reporting.
Assisting with running vulnerability scans for prospective clients prior to or during onboarding.
Collaborating with internal departments to ensure clients maintain a strong security posture.
Assisting with security training and guidance to other engineers.
Helping to develop security best practices, security standards, and documentation for the organization.
Providing excellent customer service during each interaction with clients and internal team members.
Why You'll Love Worksighted:
Competitive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, along with company matches to 401(k) and HSA accounts.
Paid time off for vacations, sick time, and personal days, plus a day off on your birthday!
Well-rounded approach to employee wellness with benefits such as a monthly wellness stipend, free healthy snacks, community service opportunities, and an Employee Assistance Program.
Mobile phone stipend.
Open and collaborative work environment (dog friendly!)
Ongoing employee engagement activities ranging from potlucks to company-wide games of virtual BINGO.
An in-depth onboarding program including lunch with leadership, job shadows with every department of the company, and thorough on-the-job training.
Learn more about our values and what it's like to be a member of our team on our website or by following us on Instagram @Worksighted (http://www.instagram.com/worksighted).

summary: Technology manages or performs work associated with analysis, design, implementation, operation, deployment, and support of Condé Nast's information technology…
job_description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others. Condé Nast Entertainment was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.
Job Description
Technology manages or performs work associated with analysis, design, implementation, operation, deployment, and support of Condé Nast's information technology resources (including computer hardware, operating systems, communications, software applications, data processing and security), telecommunication systems, and software/database products through internal staff, outsourcing staff, or consultants. Activities include developing information technology strategies, polices and plans; maintenance and use of information technology resources; training and supporting technology users; telecommunications network planning, operations and site acquisition; programming software/database products for sale to external customers; and internet product management & operations.


Network Administration is responsible for the operation, planning and maintenance of Conde Nast’s telecommunications (voice, visual, and video) and networks. They analyze the short-term and/or long-term network capacity needs for current and future network requirements; maintain network quality standards to achieve optimal levels of operation; establish tools and procedures to monitor network performance; track and monitor network traffic and performance to ensure minimal interruption to network transmission; correct network problems effectively and in a timely manner; and drive efficiencies to network facilities for improvements (i.e., enhancements, updates, upgrades, and new systems. Requires an understanding of technical aspects of telecommunications equipment and systems and vendor capabilities.


Entry-level individual contributor that contributes as the most junior team/project member


Work is closely supervised
Primary technician responsible for on-site networking support at NYC metro-area based facilities
Install new and replacement networking hardware
MDF & IDF cabling: optical and copper
Develop a high level of familiarity with the physical layout of Conde Nast’s NY metro network hubs, data centers (MDFs) and IDFs
Assist with SSL Certificate administration
Provide physical access to Conde Nast’s NY metro networking facilities for carriers and vendors
Review existing telemetry systems on a daily basis
Vendor interaction: track orders & ‘disconnects’ with ISPs
Maintain IP Address Management database
Occasional off-hours maintenance
Global and domestic travelling are possible
Stock room maintenance (e.g spare cables, hardware, etc.)
Flexible on-site work schedule
SKILLS
Basic networking principles; to include switching, routing, firewalls & load balancers
General understanding of wireless technologies (e.g. WLANs, controllers, WPA2, RF, etc)

summary: Demonstrated leadership and adaptability, with willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems, even beyond…
job_description:
Introduction
As an IBM Security Consultant, you will lead to secure the world by translating security requirements into the design and deployment of IBM Security Solutions in an agile world. The success of IBM and our customers is in your hands as you transform vital security needs into policies and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its customers to securely operate in a hostile world. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world's leading security experts.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Are you passionate about threat hunting and forensic investigations? Are you looking for a fast-paced environment where you can take part in global cyber incident response and cyber crisis management? Are you interested in joining an elite team of incident response consultants? If so, X-Force IR, IBM Security’s team of veteran incident responders, is looking for an Entry-Level Cybersecurity Consultant, and you may be the perfect fit.


At X-Force IR, we partner with Fortune 1000 clients to deliver real business value by:
Bringing together the world’s largest consulting practice with industry-leading incident response capabilities
Minimizing the revenue loss of a security incident
Applying IBM's global expertise and local capabilities through our unique global delivery network combined with our teams in over 170 countries
What do we look for in a successful X-Force Cybersecurity Consultant?
Demonstrated leadership and adaptability, with willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems, even beyond initial scope of responsibility
Thorough and analytical, with capability to apply logic to solve problems
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, while maintaining focus despite conflicting demands
Drive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results
Initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills
Effective interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals and teams, strengthening relationships to achieve win-win solutions
Ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner
A passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view
For more information about IBM Security and X-Force IR, please visit: https://www.ibm.com/security/services/incident-response-services




Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge of computer operating systems (Windows, Linux, MacOS)
Knowledge of computer networking protocols
Understanding of computer security concepts
Moderate programming skills
Experience using Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge or experience in some aspect of incident response planning, consulting, or related field
Knowledge or experience in one or more of the following security domains: Incident Response, Digital Forensics, Tabletop Exercises, Threat Hunting, or Cloud Platforms
Internship in security related field

About Business Unit
IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:


12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).Select educational reimbursement opportunities.Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.
We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

3TG Consulting is looking for a competent IT Help Desk Technician.

We are a 100% women-owned business comprised of an encouraging, supportive, and diverse team who
work to provide solutions and qualified staff for our clients. Currently, we work remotely. We maintain
a high level of communication and function as a cohesive, collaborative team. If we sound like a good fit
for you we would love to hear from you!

We are a consulting company. An extension of our consulting services is staffing. We help experienced talent
regain employment.Our recruiting, training, and staffing process ensures effective strategy, efficient planning,
and timely execution.Wespecializeintop quality direct-hire, temp-to-hire, and strategy consulting services
virtually and on-site. 3TG specializes in business operations positions from entry-level to upper-level
management, in a variety of industries.
Your goal as our IT Help Desk Technician is to create value for clients that will help preserve 3T
Consulting’s reputation and business.

email

control

Excellent communication skills
Customer-oriented and cool-tempered

job_description:

Refresh and Grow your Career with Us!
Job Overview
The IT Service Center Support has frequent contact with Coke Consolidated business partners, employees, customers, peers, and all levels of management. Our Service Center Support Technicians joyfully respond to needs with an eagerness to serve. Therefore, the technician will provide quality telephone support for IT hardware and software-related issues, with a high degree of customer satisfaction and promptly. Responsible for researching, resolving, and responding to complex questions following current high standards. The IT Service Center Support should have advanced computer troubleshooting skills and have a deeper understanding of Coke Consolidated’s processes.
Duties & Responsibilities
Assists teammates telephonically, electronically, and in-person on a wide array of support requests, including diagnostic support relating to functionality of software, troubleshooting, daily network operations, etc., while demonstrating a high level of customer service
Observes problem trends in order to report on frequent issues and documents learnings and solutions in order to assist teammates with timely and consistent resolutions to frequently asked questions, including things like account lockouts, intermittent system issues, etc. in order to improve the team’s ability to respond quickly to needs
Initiates and, or follows up with ServiceNow tickets for teammate issues and concerns
Escalates complex problems or issues to the next tier of support or the appropriate Center of Excellence for timely resolution
Assists teammates across the organization with the use of our self-service portal and knowledge base to fulfill future needs independently when practical to do so
May perform other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Positive Attitude - The role requires a positive attitude and a servant’s heart while proving Coke Consolidated customers with a single point of contact for all IT Business and Technical issues
Eagerness to Learn - Continuous learning is required as Coke Consolidated’s systems and processes continue to change. Learning these systems and processes increases the quality of service and allows greater resolution without forwarding it to Tier 2 support teams
Personal Pride and a Dedication to full Ownership - The role requires a self-drive, intrinsic motivation to serve people to improve their day, lives. This displays itself through high attendance, so teammates aren’t carrying the workload by themselves, humbly seeking and applying feedback to improve their service and a desire for continuous improvement
Provide insight and suggestions about ways to improve the Helpdesk and Support functions within IT
Flexibility - The need to work any shift on the 24,7 Service Center, includes possibly serving on nights, and weekends
Be available to provide additional coverage when Coca-Cola Consolidated has major system implementations
More advanced technical knowledge, experience, and understanding of computers, networks, and applications to be able to troubleshoot issues
A Service Center Support is required to know enough about all our systems and processes to gather data, troubleshoot possible solutions, and if unable to resolve, document enough of the troubleshooting steps to pass along to the next tier for resolution
They are also relied upon to help the Support Technician 1 employees in answering questions, to improve their knowledge and understanding
Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or GED
Knowledge acquired through 5 to up to 7 years of work experience

Headspace and Ginger have recently merged to become Headspace Health! While roles are still being recruited separately on our respective websites, new hires from this point forward will be joining Headspace Health. For more information, please speak with your recruiter!
About the IT Support Specialist at Headspace Health:
Headspace Health is looking for an IT Support Specialist, reporting to our Manager, IT Operations. The IT Support Specialist must have experience and understanding of support principles, strategy, and technical acumen. They should be a critical thinker and problem-solver with great attention to detail. Since end-user support and teamwork are important aspects of the role, excellent communication and people skills are required. The primary focus of our IT Support Specialist will be to provide end-user support to our growing staff around the world via our ticketing system utilizing email, chat, video, and phone communications.
Location: This role is open to remote employees in select US states: California, Florida, Georgia, Maryland + Washington DC, Massachusetts, Nevada, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Texas, and Washington.
How your skills and passion will come to life at Headspace Health:
Provide Tier 1 and Tier 2 support for situations requiring in-depth technical expertise
Provide technical support and/or training for systems, services and platforms in person, via email, via video conferencing, and by phone
Being resourceful and having a curious mind to find and solve the root causes of technical issues
Assisting with the management of the support queue to ensure issues are prioritized based on business needs, ensuring issues are successfully resolved
Strong customer focus mentality
Eagerness to learn and interest in developing new skills
Willingness to adapt and prioritize in real-time to meet business needs
Strong collaboration skills and willingness to be a team player
What you’ve accomplished:
2-4 years experience in a similar role, ideally supporting 300+ users in tech/creative industries
Experience using and monitoring a ticketing system, adhering to variable SLAs
Experience with Google G-Suite Enterprise administration
Experience with Microsoft Office 365 software and user management
Experience with SaaS application access management via Single Sign On (SSO) (OneLogin experience a plus)
Experience in creative environments supporting Adobe CC, audio/post-production and Digital Asset Management (DAM) platforms a plus
Experience supporting collaboration and video telepresence systems, remotely and in-person (meetings, events, and webinars) (Zoom a plus)
Experience supporting MacOS and associated imaging technologies (BASH scripting a plus)
Experience supporting Windows 10 (Command Line / PowerShell a plus)
Intermediate understanding of change management and IT security principals
Intermediate understanding of wired and wireless networking technologies a plus (Cisco Meraki preferred)
Available to assist with after-hours support for urgent requests
How we feel about Diversity & Inclusion:
Headspace Health is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.
Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Headspace Health. Please inform our Talent team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.
How to get started:
If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Headspace Health, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications.
